result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Jerome Lyons

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael Jerome Lyons appeared by video.  Attorney Jade K Hall appeared by video for Michael Jerome Lyons.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 11, Judge Swanson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 11.
Scheduling conference scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael Jerome Lyons not in court.  Attorney Jade K Hall appeared by video for Michael Jerome Lyons.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defendant does not appear. Defense Counsel reports that the defendant is hospitalized and having medical issues. Court orders previously STAYED Bench Warrant to continue until the next court date. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Jade K Hall in court.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Mr Lyons does not appear due to medical issues. Court will impose, but stay a warrant until the next date and ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Michael Jerome Lyons in court, appear in person.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated June 3, 2022 - received

Defendant Michael Jerome Lyons in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated April 22, 2022 - received
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with Sarah A.S.; Serena B.; Sandrine W.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Michael Jerome Lyons in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Michael Jerome Lyons in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael Jerome Lyons appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
